perturbation.original_text: Within 7 Business Days after the end of each calendar quarter, the Billing Party shall provide the other party with an itemized statement, subject to adjustment within 30 days of receipt of such statement, setting forth the Net Revenue achieved over the preceding calendar quarter, and shall include such other information as may be mutually agreed upon by the parties (the "Revenue Report"). The Revenue Report shall be accompanied by payment to the Non-Billing Party of all amounts owed as set forth on such Revenue Report, as well as - when applicable - the exchange currency rate.
perturbation.changed_text: Within 7 Business Days after the end of each calendar quarter, the Billing Party shall provide the other party with an itemized statement, subject to adjustment within 30 days of receipt of such statement, setting forth the Net Revenue achieved over the preceding calendar quarter, and shall include such other information as may be mutually agreed upon by the parties (the "Revenue Report"). The Revenue Report shall be accompanied by payment to the Non-Billing Party of all amounts owed as set forth on such Revenue Report, as well as - when applicable - the exchange currency rate. However, payment is due within 60 days of the Revenue Report date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that payment should accompany the Revenue Report, implying immediate payment. The added sentence contradicts this by allowing for payment within 60 days of the report date, creating a conflict regarding the payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event that the other party is in default or breach of any material provision of this Agreement, and such default or breach continues unremedied for a period of sixty days after written notice thereof. In addition to the right to terminate this Agreement, the non-breaching party, shall have all rights and remedies available at law and in equity.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event that the other party is in default or breach of any material provision of this Agreement, and such default or breach continues unremedied for a period of sixty days after written notice thereof. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Dassault Systemes can terminate the contract immediately, without any prior notice or cure period, in the event of PlanetCAD failing to provide Level 2 support as outlined in Schedule B. In addition to the right to terminate this Agreement, the non-breaching party, shall have all rights and remedies available at law and in equity.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a 60-day cure period for any breach before termination. The added sentence contradicts this by allowing Dassault Systemes to terminate immediately for a specific breach (failure of Level 2 support), creating uncertainty about the general applicability of the cure period.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be assigned or otherwise transferred, by operation of law or otherwise without the express written consent of PlanetCAD and Dassault Systemes, but in such event the assigning Party shall give notice to the non-assigning Party and the non-assigning Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement within the 30-day period following receipt of such notice.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be assigned or otherwise transferred, by operation of law or otherwise without the express written consent of PlanetCAD and Dassault Systemes, but in such event the assigning Party shall give notice to the non-assigning Party and the non-assigning Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement within the 30-day period following receipt of such notice. However, Dassault Systemes may assign the contract to any of its wholly-owned subsidiaries without requiring consent or providing notification.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that assignment is not allowed without express written consent, however, the new text states that Dassault Systemes can assign the contract without any notifications or approval to its subsidiaries, which creates a conflict of assignment protocols.
